title: BNB and Solana fade as Polygon becomes most popular blockchain for games - Blockchain Gamer
content:
BNB and Solana fade as Polygon becomes most popular blockchain for games

Sign up to our Substack, follow us on Twitter and connect with us on Linkedin.

At the halfway mark through 2023 we’re crunching data from the Big Blockchain Game List. First up, we’re looking at the number of blockchain games that have ceased development.

158 blockchain games were discontinued during H1 2023, bringing the total of games that have been taken off the list because they have been discontinued to 248.

BNB experienced the highest number of failures with 39 titles, followed by Polygon (26) and Ethereum (27), although in the case of Ethereum, many of those games have transitioned to other EVM chains. Champions Ascension’s move from Ethereum to Polygon is one high profile example.

Solana lost 24 games: again this isn’t surprising given market conditions.

Looking at the blockchains with the most games, the trend is similar with BNB losing its #1 position to Polygon, which currently has 98 games (12%) compared to BNB’s 80 (10%).

Ethereum is third on 10% followed by Solana on 6% and IMX on 5%. Notably, Solana has slipped back from 10% to 6% since November 2022 whilst IMX has seen an increase from 3%.

The largest gainer is the category Multichain games, which includes games deployed on one or more chains, currently on 17%.

title: Solana Solar Partners With Kratos RES To Supply Clean And Renewable Power In The Philippines - SolarQuarter
content:
Solana Solar Alpha Inc. (Solana Solar), a wholly-owned subsidiary of Alternergy Group’s Solar Pacific Energy Corporation (Solar Pacific), announced the signing of a power supply agreement with Kratos RES, Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary of Villar Group’s Prime Asset Ventures, Inc. (PAVI) engaged in retail electricity supply.

Solana Solar will supply Kratos RES with 10 MW and up to 20 MW of clean and renewable power from the soon-to-be-built Solana Solar Power Project located in Hermosa, Bataan.

“We are pleased to partner with Kratos RES to help its electricity end-consumers achieve their sustainability goals and transition their power supply to renewable energy,” Alternergy Chairman and Solana Solar Chairman and President Vicente S. Pérez Jr. said.

“The Solana Solar Power Project will provide reliable and cost-competitive electricity supply to malls, offices, complexes and manufacturing facilities served by Kratos, whose businesses require operational and cost efficiencies. By partnering with Kratos, we are proud to assist these sectors make sustainability part of how they operate,” Solar Pacific Chief Executive Officer Mike Lichtenfeld said.

Kratos RES welcomed the partnership with Solar Pacific. “Kratos is committed to delivering the needs of our customers with a high-quality supply and in a cost-efficient manner. Our partnership with Solana Solar will help address these,” Jose Rommel Orillaza, Kratos RES Operations Head, said.

The 20MWAC/28WDC Solana Solar Power Project has recently secured financing commitments from a leading Philippine commercial bank and a commitment for the Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) from a leading EPC provider. Early works activities have started with the full-swing construction to commence in the coming months.

title: Coca Cola Serbia partners with Solana-based NFT marketplace SolSea - CryptoSlate
content:
Solana-based NFT platform SolSea said that has partnered with Coca-Cola’s Serbian division, Coca-Cola Srbija, on July 5.

SolSea said that the partnership will involve the offer of merchandise as well as Coca-Cola Serbia-branded non-fungible tokens (NFTs).

The two companies are offering the NFTs and merch in partnership with EXIT Festival, a summer music festival that takes place annually in Novi Sad, Serbia during the first week of July. The 2023 festival runs between July 6 and July 9.

SolSea also acknowledged a post from the NFT market ALL.ART, which explained the offer in greater detail. ALL.ART said that the offer involves a festival installation called the “Magic Mirror,” which dresses attendees in random merchandise and displays them in real-time 3D. The Magic Mirror installation allows the attendee to take a picture of themselves by scanning a QR code with their mobile device.

The offer includes 100 exclusive hoodies, which are offered to VIP members and are paired with NFTs. It also includes short-sleeved and sleeveless shirts, though AllArt’s announcement does not indicate that these items have associated NFTs.

Coca-Cola highly involved with NFTs

The current offer is limited to Coca-Cola’s Serbian division. However, Coca-Cola has been involved with various other NFT projects in the past.

In July 2021, Coca-Cola auctioned four charity NFTs for International Friendship Day; those NFTs exist on Ethereum (ETH), according to OpenSea records. It also sold a second round of charity NFTs on Polygon (MATIC) to commemorate that date in 2022.

Also in 2022, Coca-Cola offered Pride Month NFTs for charity, while its Middle East division offered FIFA World Cup Qatar NFTs in partnership with Crypto.com.

Other major brands including Marvel, Starbucks, and Porsche have also begun to work with NFTs. While some critics dismiss corporate NFT offers as “cash grabs,” some sales raise funds for charity and provide opportunities for crypto artists and creators.

Mentioned in this article

title: Coca-Cola Serbia Unveils NFTs on Solana's SolSea - Crypto Times
content:
In an innovative blend of corporate branding and digital assets, Coca-Cola Serbia has teamed up with SolSea, a non-fungible token (NFT) marketplace built on the Solana blockchain. This initiative will allow fans of the beverage giant to acquire exclusive merchandise and NFTs.

🚨NFT ANNOUNCEMENT 🚨



Unique blend of fashion, art, music, and tech.



SolSea joins hands with @CocaColaSrbija for @ExitFestival 2023 🚀New heights with exclusive merch, Coca-Cola Serbia NFTs, and a noble cause! Creating a new dimension for festival-lovers and impacting lives.🔥 pic.twitter.com/UUY40CwdrL — SolSea (@SolSeaNFT) July 5, 2023

Coca-Cola Serbia’s venture into the world of NFTs is in association with the renowned EXIT Festival, set to take place from July 6 to July 9, 2023. The partnership employs an interactive installation called the “Magic Mirror,” which will provide attendees with a real-time 3D view of themselves wearing randomly selected merchandise.

Adding to the exclusivity, the collaboration will feature 100 distinctive hoodies that will be paired with matching NFTs for VIP members of the festival. This unique blend of physical and digital commodities reinforces the ever-growing interest of major brands in the NFT space.

Coca-Cola is not new to the NFT scene. Past projects include charity NFT auctions for International Friendship Day and Pride Month. Furthermore, its Middle East division has partnered with Crypto.com to launch NFTs for the FIFA World Cup Qatar.

This wave of corporate interest in NFTs isn’t just limited to Coca-Cola. Other major brands like Marvel, Starbucks, and Porsche have also ventured into the world of digital collectibles.

While some critics label these moves as mere cash grabs, others recognize the potential for corporations to raise funds for charitable causes and provide support to crypto artists and creators through these initiatives.

Coca-Cola Serbia’s partnership with SolSea offers a fresh and immersive way for fans to interact with the brand, reinforcing the impact of NFTs in modern marketing strategies.

title: Frank DeGods: the Founder of Two Solana-based NFT Projects - The Coin Republic
content:
Frank DeGods aka Rohun Vora, has passionately worked in the techno-space. With his knowledge, he later used it to found two Solana-based non-fungible token (NFT) projects. Solana, a blockchain platform, uses proof-of-stake (PoS) mechanism and provides smart contract functionality. He also co-founded DeLabs, a startup company, which created DeGods and y00ts.

Frank DeGods and his Journey

Frank DeGods was working on movie sets when he was teenager. At that point, he was inspired to study film at University of California (UCLA), a public land-grant research university in Los Angeles, California. However, he dropped out and then pursued his entrepreneurial desires.

The founder of DeGods and y00ts was accepted to the startup fund and program Y Combinator, a startup accelerator company, where he raised $1.3 Million. He then joined a coding boot camp and worked at Main Street, a software development company where he raised an almost $500-Million valuation.

Frank then found the Solana ecosystem quite useful and boosted his knowledge in the blockchain platform. Later in 2021, he established significant clout with the community after starting DeLabs. However, his goals went far beyond the blockchain platform, with DeGods and y00ts poised to become multichain endeavors.

Notably, DeGods left Solana in 2023 for Ethereum while bridging over to Bitcoin as Ordinals Inscriptions. On the other hand, y00ts found a home on another well-known blockchain.

Frank revealed his identity as Rahul Vora in November 2022, as he shared a screenshot from his own Instagram account on his Twitter account. Meanwhile, the web3 community also showed his massive support and welcomed him. Not only this, but the entrepreneurial spirit of Frank also praised his resilience in chasing his tech aspirations, and later on gaining popularity in the NFT space.

Frank DeGods and his Activeness on Twitter

Frank DeGods is quite active on his Twitter account and keeps updating his thoughts on recent happenings. On Rohun Vora’s Twitter account, he shared his recent podcast hosted by NFT Now, a web3 media platform. The long-tailed Twitter thread starts with “his life before DeGods.”

What @frankdegods was up to before building a $250M multi-chain empire



🧵👇



(1/18) pic.twitter.com/8UFtmuR4aP — topsmoke.eth (@realtopsmoke) May 4, 2023

During the podcast, he said “I wanted to write and direct motion pictures, so I applied to all these different film schools. I grew up in LA, and I started working professionally in the film industry when I was 14.”

Furthermore, on a question “What was the moment that red-pilled you on entrepreneurship?” Frank answered, “Paul Graham. I remember I was on Reddit and found this Paul Graham essay. I read it and I was like holy fuck. Everything this guy is saying makes so much sense.”

At the end, Frank added “By the time we started DeGods, I had four full-time jobs working them all at the same time. I had this core group of friends and we were always scheming like yo let’s start a business, let’s go make a TikTok account, let’s go do something…”
